author: g11tech
content: hey guys, i have a question regarding the format of req/response error, from what i understand it is: <error result><error message>, but it seems that lighthouse is expecting that error message to be snappy frame encode, and seems to be logging error for invalid snappy response (and downscoring lodestar in process)

author: g11tech
content: is my understanding correct? how do other CLs expect the req/resp error response?

author: g11tech
content: for e.g. we are sending these chunks as error response:  e.g. 1: `[0x03, 0x524553504f4e53455f4552524f525f52]`

author: g11tech
content:
this seems to be the corresponding log on lighthouse client for processing this response: ```16Uiu2HAkv7Qy6x4VpZN3zby7ToAef38ugpaQKQe15LSiUMmRjQg4, client: Lodestar: version: 0.36.2, err: IO Error: snappy: corrupt input (expected stream header but got unexpected chunk type byte 69), protocol: beacon_blocks_by_range, service: libp2p, module: lighthouse_network::peer_manager:439
```

author: g11tech
content: indeed with frame encoding the error message, this got resolved, just wondering why we need overhead of frame encoding error messgae
